review:

review:
На удивление, эта отомэ оказалась очень даже хороша!

Почему на удивление? Потому что: девочки, никому не рекомендую начинать чтение с ветки чела в очках (не запомнила их имена, хотя жизненные истории остались в памяти хорошо). Его характер, диалоги, в целом вся сюжетная линии прописана так, словно это ваш первый фанфик, написанный в подростковом возрасте (постельные сцены даже не буду комментировать, это стыыыд). Идея мужчины в возрасте, которую и ожидают от этой игры, в данном персонаже совсем не раскрылась.

Хорошо, что я решила посмотреть на сюжетные линии других персонажей! Их как будто бы писал другой человек. Действительно имеющие место быть переживания, живой характер самих персонажей и событий вокруг них. Единственное, что главная героиня как была жутко смущённой так и осталась во всех ветках, но это травма практически всех отомэ

author: {'steamid': '76561198273931392', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1101, 'last_played': 1692298797}
review:
我命油我不油天之美军看了想连夜攻打，橙光不过审版之[h1]我和叔叔谈恋爱[/h1]


[u]①剧情（全是剧透）[/u]
个人喜好：丰泉＞法幢＞汤濑本篇＞树神＞安良城＞＞汤濑续章

[h1]会社社长[/h1]
[b]汤濑龙之介[/b]·Yuze Ryunosuke  [spoiler]CV：井上和彦[/spoiler]
初心的大叔，[strike]一眼顶针鉴定为李泽言老年版的类型[/strike]，但性格其实还挺傲娇，直接被女主三下五除二拿下了，真的有被冰山诈骗到……
本篇内容还好，一场酒后乱吻引发的猜心游戏，能泡到中年单身总裁真的被你女主赚到了吼~汤濑的设定是由于斯托卡引发的恐女症，但工作是卖女性内衣这点反差还蛮好笑的，喜欢粉色花纹内衣的霸总。
作为亲儿子[strike]亲爹[/strike]待遇，居然有两段大篇章，但续章的内容也太令人难评了……
公司总裁和作为秘书的太太在办公室疯狂doi，被竞争对手拍到了之后当做要挟要收购公司，一边保护公司一边心疼爱人，后续女主所有的事情都强行降智——太太，你也不想自己老公破产吧，堕落吧成为我的人……什么本子phb剧情啊受不了！？
按自己想法，选完结局居然只有不到50分？！中途一度以为我哪一步选错导致锁分了……
只能说，樱花妹的脑回路和熊猫妹确实是…不一样，这本子在晋江会被喷死吧……
结局更是重量寄，用来吸引客人的手段居然是女主当众脱衣大秀内衣？？给我整不会了……汤濑您是有点子绿帽癖在身上的我说。
总结：续章，狗都不玩。


[h1]刑事[/h1]
[b]树神秀彰[/b]·Kodama Hideaki  [spoiler]CV：关俊彦[/spoiler]
警察是我最想嫁的职业no.1捏，阿秀警官怕鬼又怕黑，阳光开朗有魅力真的很苏呀~剧情写的还算合理，年少的苦痛经历与成年后的不悦案件交织，让他成为患得患失甚至怀疑自己是否有活下去资格的可怜人，这是一个女主变成他救赎的故事——不幸的童年要用一生去治愈的故事。
确认关系后会担心自己年龄和女主差太多，调侃自己可以当她爸爸的桥段也比较忍俊不禁，让人想起远藤宪一和渡部笃郎演的《让我叫声“爹”》了。
但不得不说，还是在别人篇章里的树神比较有魅力，在自己的主场，反而因为一些言不由衷、瞻前顾后，变得扭扭捏捏甜度下降（叹气）


[h1]Bartender[/h1]
[b]丰泉聪一郎[/b]·Toyoizumi Souichiro  [spoiler]CV：堀内贤雄[/spoiler]
体验很好的一章，前清水后狂野，互通心意之前绝不碰女主分毫，但言语间暧昧到眼神儿都拉丝儿的欲言又止感——爱是伸出又收回的手。
女主初次表明心意时，丰泉明明开心的要心脏爆掉，还是克制住声音说：确定吗？和我这种年龄的人？是的呀，喜欢的人是想要做的呀，一瞬间把女主问蒙了。
比较震撼的是无论在kiss还是doi的时候都会说：睁看眼睛看着我，看好你在和谁做……真的一整个大震惊，又色又霸气。途中能把女主做睡着，做完腰疼一天的小细节也真的很爆笑就是了2333
故事线也还好，无敌全能的哥哥养活废物弟弟几十年，养到两个人都成了老头子，才终于等到第一个愿意和他携手从自家酒吧迎接清晨的女人。


[h1]恋爱小说家[/h1]
[b]法幢赖寿[/b]·Hodo Yorihisa  [spoiler]CV：小杉十郎太[/spoiler]
双赢赌局的恋爱游戏，这一章的剧情设置最具戏剧性。记得当时初见第一位选的他，倒不是因为设定喜欢，纯粹是听了闺蜜想看的选了大学教授……结果压根儿和师生恋没关系（楽）。
顶级pua大师，接吻狂魔，放置play高手，明明看上去是个草食系结果居然是所有人里最黑的……
唯二个提到前任的角色，反而让这位年过半百的大叔在所有人里因为真实感脱颖而出：毕竟现实里，这个pub如果聚集了一堆40+未婚大龄金龟婿，很难不让人觉得是个gay pub吧……
除了在初期把女主玩弄虐待到身心俱疲之外，后期又当头一棒告知对方她只是亡妻的代餐，宛宛类卿了属于是……法幢老师的线是真难选，没有故意去走，居然结局只有不到50分，这男人心里到底在想什么啊（恼怒）
倒是出了个金句——男人是不要爱情也可以doi的生物。[strike]代入到女主，整个萎掉了靴靴……[/strike]


[h1]辩护士[/h1]
[b]安良城护[/b]·Arashiro Mamoru  [spoiler]CV：小山力也[/spoiler]
立绘表现最优越没有之一的幸运儿，浪子回头的极道律师，和女主年龄差小到可以喊大哥的伪叔叔。只不过简介诈骗，丝毫没看出来“女权”在哪儿……卟是很理解你们霓虹女权的理解哈。
与前任以及黑帮老大儿子有一场以死相逼的三角恋，乙游男前任活不过开局定律√
很大胆的拿下女主一血居然是深夜公园的夜炮，以及不出意外的被拍到，[strike]这游戏每次不在私密空间doi就会被拍下当证据定律……[/strike]
整体剧情没什么槽点和记忆点，一眼猜到的结局，但立绘表现是真的优越，是上面四位男士羡慕出水的程度。


[h1]外科医生[/h1]
[b]百目鬼春臣[/b]·Doumeki Hruomi  [spoiler]CV：藤原启治[/spoiler]
别找了，没有彩蛋，这是CM诈骗，并不存在这个人……
为什么啊！？上了steam的最终完成版本，把这个人吞掉了为什么为什么为什么？？？甚至不愿放进DLC……藤原老师遗作又少一部我哭死。



[u]②画面&操作[/u]
没有云存档真的不明白这种游戏存在的意义……
界面UI是典中典的日式乙女手游那种廉价flash模板。翻译的不咋地，错字连篇，排版不对，您制作组完全没有校对是吗？
作为一个视觉小说，手柄不支持也就算了，居然还不能鼠标滚轮翻页？！这种反人类的操作我建议彻底滚出Visual Novel界哈，鼠标好悬没给我按烂了。
画面很崩，让本就油腻的故事显得更加咸湿了……看了下原设是わいあっと太太，谁懂啊心在滴血，怎么说呢……不能因为是米给的少的商稿就摸了吧，有些立绘丑到截图但又怕污染自己列表不敢放出来……这很难评。



[u]③音乐&文字[/u]
连贯性超级差！差到爆！！不是音乐本身不好，由于章节本身的跳跃性，导致前一秒还是开车的暧昧配乐，下一秒马上收放开始进入谈事bgm……割裂感很强的好吧！
加上文字写的很咸湿，一些简单粗暴的文字描述感觉在看男性向的小黄文噗噗噗
没有配音，却又不是完全没声音。不理解为什么官方肯花大价格请知名叔系声优去配广播剧，也不愿意让他们哪怕录个“哼”、“哈”、“哦”、”唔“在游戏正片里……为什么啊（恼怒）哪怕配个关键语句也好嘛！

author: {'steamid': '76561199162702258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 855, 'last_played': 1688219799}
review:
I tried very hard to like this game, and i mean this with ALL my heart here... you can just find better stories by randomly clicking on any wattpad fanfic.
Its not the oldness that puts me off or anything (thats actually why i was interested) its...like,everything around it,yeah i wasnt expecting much but its genuinely disappointing.i think i genuinely have trauma from some of these scenes.There were some really cute parts,but its surrounded by awful awful parts,so its kinda just not worth it at all.I dont think ive played anything else from the creators but i do hope they improved their writing skills with other games...

i think the best route i played was Yuze's, he had a decent amount of respect for the protagonist and they both got along quite nicely, but there were some really weird bad parts thrown in there that just...REALLY haunt me (why did they make a cg of the protagonist LICKING his mouth...lol,no offense to the artist,i know they moved on to make some really amazing art) it acts like its going to be a mature game.but its a mature game written for teenagers,i think.this just doesnt really feel all that "adult" in the ways it should,then again,i guess its hard to write for older characters when your so used to young adults and the like!
overall,get this on sale if your really curious,but i doubt your gonna actually complete the game (i had planned to 100% it,but i had to drop for my own sanity,and i can persevere through otome plots,hell,im an otome PRO lol and this still made me drop.really sad honestly) itd be cool to maybe see them make a remake or something,or maybe just another old man otome,i think id try it out...but yknow...doubt thats really gonna happen

author: {'steamid': '76561199273444749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1673427390}
review:
以下————仅代表个人看法：
       树神线，店长线能够符合这个价钱应有的价值（原价的话倒也真的不很值），安良城也还行（前期一般有点过火），剩下的那俩就......玩的好窒息
       整体剧情流程方面，一个人线路＋后话番外平均是两小时，每个人都有不同的剧情和主线，对于每个人的攻略方式和套路也不一样是优点，还有一个优点就是每个人的人设都做得算是蛮的OK真的都还不错，每个人都有自己的独特风格特色和观念什么的，人物是饱满的。无虐，甜饼，HE，叔控可尝试。优点方面中规中矩，没有什么好很吹夸的，只是乙女游戏基本该做的一些基本大方面没太出错就是了（缺点有 在下面）。个人最喜欢树神线，其次是店长线，其次安良城线，个人魅力都挺大的也很甜（树神你最可爱啦）。
       缺点方面，缺点巨大，在玩之前我还期待了一下会不会有声优不过当然是不可能的（甚至连语音条都没有），场景来回就那几个也算不上精致和用心，人物立绘有些有严重脸崩情况真的很致命（汤和法俩人的立绘就是...真的不想再吐槽了，脸部问题真的致命，法的立绘是怎么可以那么的...怪异，尤其是那个衣服我真的见一次皱一眉。这也是我玩这两人线路体验感差的重要原因）CG基本崩坏严重我不忍心看，有些简直就是在攻击我的眼睛。谢邀了，乙女游戏这么潦草简直就是一秒下头
女主恋爱脑且完全被动又无脑，简直就是离谱他妈妈给离谱开门 离谱到家了，我玩了这么多乙游这个女主真的是会让我锤键盘的程度，而且脑回路很莫名，面对明明是在被调戏的反应也让我狠狠无语。典型害羞小白花娇妻型女主，遇到的危险都是为了给男主英雄救美作铺垫，毫无个人特色风格，普通且我感觉不到亮点，太被动。整个游戏就内核方面，完全是老一套的依赖被动式套路（可能跟年份有关系，毕竟早期乙游了在这女性意识方面真的不强）
讲道理，有一些场景和对话，就是大家聚在一起的时候什么的，我明白制作的可能是想让玩家感觉到那种温馨的氛围之类的，那就我个人而言基本上是有点失败的因为真的太  尴  尬，槽点很多，我已经很久很久没有在乙女游戏里体验这么尴尬的感觉了，女主那种“看到大家就感觉坏心情烟消云散了呢”的感觉原谅我真的理解不能，那根本不是正常很要好的朋友们之间的感觉啊反正就是不对味啊！哦还有一点，汉化bug多。
乙女游戏制作门槛低，但是真正的乙女玩家对于乙女游戏的要求是很高的，我曾经在窒息时刻用这个游戏是2016年的不要要求那么高啦之类的来安慰自己但是说真的，从个人标准上来说这个游戏就是达不到要求，游戏质感会有一种廉价感，游戏整体最大卖点就是大叔年龄差成熟感这种类型但是讲真的我觉得制作商并没有掌控好，划分的话也是属于那种平平无奇的类型，老套的女主性格和剧情进程，（单看剧情方面前期还行 后期矛盾冲突解决的太草率会感觉前面白铺垫那么久）是一个老乙游人搭眼一瞧就知道会是什么发展的那种等级的乙女游戏。
       总体中等（稍微有点偏下但又没有很差），原价不值且会亏。(我个人对于乙女游戏的要求稍微比较严格，但原价真的不值) 玩的时候不能带脑子玩，尤其是对于乙女游戏要求和门槛偏高的玩家，玩的时候最好别太走心，就当无聊看看剧情图一乐就行 。当然啦，如果你没有那么高的标准要求，那么玩得开心！

Dazu kommt, dass die Kerle halt auch einfach unfassbar ugly sind - auch die CG Artworks sind einfach scheiß hässlich. Haben Dogenza noch nie geile alte Kerle gesehen? Vorallem weil deren erstes Spiel mit den Nutten soviel schönere Artworks hatten.

Ein positives hat es - alle anderen Otomes, die ich hiernach spiele, werden vermutlich besser sein :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198375376735', 'num_games_owned': 290, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 1273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1650731753}
review:
是熟悉的逆转吉原的系统，但在这个机翻和错别字的程度下，我竟然会说我打得挺愉快的，真是没想到。作为乙女不算优秀，也不能说我推荐，但是是在特定的心境里给我带来了快乐的作品。（其实就是我累了！）

不知道为什么，这个游戏确实打造出了pub的那种轻松氛围，大叔们都挺可爱的，看成年人谈恋爱就是舒服啊……而且这个奇特的翻译方式，还让我看出了文艺片的感觉。我竟然打着法幢的线开始思考人生？（明明我第一个打树神线的时候给这个的定位是成年人的轻松小甜饼啊？）法幢该说不愧是作家吗也太会了，这种涌动的暧昧+不可捉摸的感觉真的抓人……[strike]但是我基本每一个选项都是错的，他可真是我捉摸不透的男人啊。[/strike]我对大叔是没有什么特别的偏爱啦，但是不得不说人生指导还是安良城大叔可靠啊。比较不满意的可能是汤濑线，有一些比较奇怪的加好感选项[spoiler]比如选内衣的颜色什么的[/spoiler]，[strike]而且他还有两篇[/strike]。续篇也是一些我选不选都没什么分别但是非要选违心的那个选项来加好感然后实际做我内心选择的那个选项的事（不排除其他线也有可能有这种选择但是我在他的线感受比较强烈。）然后就是对大叔我可以无压力，但是对聪一郎这种爷爷辈的我还是没能做好心理建设……树神原本是我喜欢的类型但是我觉得还是法幢和安良城的线写得比较出彩一点。不推荐给所有人，因为我觉得画风和内容还是比较偏猎奇了。

review:
[b][i]Pub Encounter[/i][/b] is typical [i]Dogenzaka Lab[/i] game. Take it or leave it. Personally, I think it is one of the better ones and I quite enyoyed it.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+ Middle aged suitors.
+ Personalities and history of the characters.
+ Background music.

[b]Cons:[/b]
- Translation. But you can live with it.
- Art. Sprites were good, but CGs were not my taste. Mostly close-up views of the faces.
- Romantic content was nice, but considering the set up, I would appreciate more of it.

Definitely wait for a discount and then enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357060329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1635496259}
review:
There are a lot of problems with this game.

The Protag: 

She's extremely bland and makes a lot of really dumb choices. I get that she's supposed to be younger and therefore not as "wise" as the love interests (and even when I put it in quotations, I'm still using that word very generously), but there's a lot of choices she makes that go against basic common sense. On top of that, she has a lot of moments where she's extremely annoying. Just to name a few examples, she apologizes all the time for everything, she bursts into tears over everything, and she never stops being shy and embarrassed even after boning any of the love interests. "Yes, we've already had a few sex scenes in the game, but how dare you see me naked just now! I'll never live it down!" Maybe it's a cultural thing, I don't know, but it comes across as ridiculous. And of course, protags aren't always going to be perfect, but when you're the one who has to play that character, it can get exceptionally frustrating.

The Men:

Their routes range from the cliched "I could never love again... but true love wins!" to, "What the hell did I just read?!" Granted, the parts that land in the latter category are a lot more interesting so I've gotta give it that, but it's still one hell of a whiplash after a few routes have already given you the expectation that there's not going to be anything particularly remarkable about any of them.

Some of the men are very manipulative, which I guess isn't too much of a bad thing. After all, troubled relationships are a thing and you can't always expect these kinds of stories to end with the relationship being a perfectly healthy one. But, unfortunately, the protag never seems to understand when she's in a bad situation and should probably reconsider things. Once she wants the guy, come hell or high water, she's going to stay with the guy even when it's probably a bad idea. And that's just when it comes to the way they treat her.

Either way, you can expect the same formula with all of them. They flirt, they start to get close, drama happens, the man disappears for anywhere from a week to a month (think 3rd act breakup), the other men tell the protag to keep trying, they reunite, they lived happily ever after.

Some of the men are, however, not a bad choice so there's a decent mix of both.

Lots of Typos:

I understand when these games get translated there's usually going to be a few mistakes here and there. And that's fine. But then there are times when it's just inexcusable. For example, in Mamoru's route, there's a few times when they accidentally use the wrong name. Ex: ""Did you need anything?" I asked. "No thanks," Shiori said as he stood up." And no, that's not when the POV switched over to Mamoru. That was when it was still Shiori. And there are a lot of mistakes in general, making it very distracting.

The Music:

It's bad. That's all. Just bad.

Repetitive Writing:

The epilogues are the biggest culprits when it comes to this. These often drag on and often close out the route in a very clunky manner. There's usually at least one important plot point that will happen so it's not like skipping it is much of an option, but you have to get through a lot of repetitive dialogue and narration to get to it. And even then it'll often stretch past the point where it could have just ended. Other moments are either poorly translated or written and I'm honestly not sure which it is. There's moments where the characters will have professed their love for each other, and then in the next breath claim they don't know how the other feels about them. Or they'll react to a love confession as though it's the first time they've heard it even though it was already said earlier.

All of that said, I can't say I fully hated the game. At the very least, I wanted to get to the end of some of the routes because I genuinely wanted to know what happened. Others I kinda slogged through as a matter of principle. But at the same time I can't really recommend it. If you really want to give this game a try, I'd advise waiting for it to be on sale at least.

review:
Easily one of my favorite visual novels by Dogenzaka Lab. You don't usually get novels strictly about dating older men and I thoroughly appreciated the change from same-age-range romances. I really loved that the story takes age-gap factors into consideration, depending on which love interest you choose, and I'm certain this would appeal greatly to anyone that doesn't see age as a "deal breaker".

Each route is pleasantly distinguishable from another, there are virtually no typos or grammar issues (HECK YES!), and I have happily played this over a few times. ;) 

10/10 for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121825416', 'num_games_owned': 1302, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1373, 'last_played': 1618008056}
review:
Among all the Dogen games I've played -see reviews- this one was one of the "Not bad" ones.

I don't know if it is a character thing, or it is because I'm close to 30 right now, all the other games with young, energetic LI's were quite tiring for me. Even though the story and the LI's in here are definitely NOT perfect, pacing and the level of maturity was a pleasant change for me.

MC is I guess around her early or mid 20's looking at how LIs keep emphasizing the youth and the age gap. Although she is shallow half the time and quick to fall in love without knowing the smallest thing about the LI, she was one of the most assertive ones I've seen up until this point (though I'm quite new to this genre).

Given that I wouldn't be considered as a young adult or fresh youth at the nice and ripe age of 28(lol), I found LIs -apart from Soichiro- were quite charming compared to other games I've played. I'm not judging if you're into way-way-older men, but honestly, I just played Soichiro's route so fast that it could be a new speed reading record on my side. It was quite creepy, to be honest. Although apart from his route, he is a quite charming old man you can easily chat as a bartender or an acquaintance. Most people in the reviews mentioned Yorihisa and Mamoru being manipulative. Yorihisa was manipulative all right, especially at the end of his route I was appalled by what was in the box he gave to the MC. Even though he doesn't explicitly -as far as I remember- do it, he compares MC with someone from the past. Ryunosuke has the most stable route I guess. He is shy and not very comfortable with women, quite understandably considering some things he experienced. Hideaki has a sad story but boi his route is fast-paced and underdeveloped. I would love to have a longer and well-written Hideaki route instead of a needless 2nd season of Ryunosuke honestly. Mamoru didn't strike me as a manipulative one but an exaggerated version of a PLAYA with a big ego (he accepts his ego is massive) and since I'm quite an avid Yakuza fan, his story piqued my interest a lot (He is also the youngest - and one of the types I liked design-wise). Like Hideaki, I would love to see a more detailed version of his story too because it was short and fast-paced too. 

The artworks were quite good, but there is an inconsistency between them regarding MC's eyes. Like, in one artwork she has eyes, in the other, she doesn't have them. In some of them, her facial features, in general, are extremely vague. Other than that, similar to other Dogen titles I've played, 3 of the characters have the same face model with little tweaks. I don't expect them to be extremely different from each other, but they are too similar. Music was repetitive, but most of the time it was a smooth melody, so I've just decreased it while playing.

Personally, I liked the game. Is it perfect? Nah. It is a cheap, smutty, otome game that has characters whose behaviors would definitely be problematic one way or another in a normal society. But compared to the ones I've played up until this point, I've enjoyed this one. I would recommend buying IF it is on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561199117975314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1082, 'last_played': 1699908097}
review:
[h1] My overall review: [/h1]
I have very mixed feelings about this game. I enjoyed it very much and it was without a doubt my favorite out of Dogenzaka Labs, but it shares every fault that comes with the title. I would advise you to buy it only from a sale.

In so many instances the characters defined what a woman is, what a man is not, making me feel like I'm having a conversation with my grandfather. Those moments, and some more similar views, were most of what my annoyance came from.

The rest of this review will contain spoilers.

[b] The MC [/b]
She was bold, didn't have a problem pursuing the guy she liked, flirted, and admitted her feelings with ease. I was really surprised by her openness and eagerness.

The biggest problem was whenever the guy of the route touched her without her consent, refusing to stop despite her protests, she excused his actions, saying, "this is okay if it's going to help/make him believe me."

Another thing I hate is when the guys make disrespectful jokes about her because they consider it 'teasing,' it's usually framed as flattering, so all she does is blush in response.

[b] The Story [/b]
The MC discovers a pub named Audire. This happens the first thing you start the prologue, so you don't deal with anything that doesn't play around the guys.

Most of the backstories weren't handled nicely. Dogenzaka Lab has a way that never changes. [i]The MC realizes her feelings, things happen, casually unwrapping backstories without much thought, confession, and happy ending.[/i] 

Each of the guys has a Tragic™ backstory, which makes them closed off to the MC at first. But of course, she sticks her nose into their business and learns all about their problems. After this, pretty much everything turns out okay. In some of the routes, the guy has to face his past, but usually, just after he shares his problem with the MC, he heals.

[b] The Guys [/b]
A few of them harassed the MC without much remorse, very Dogenzaka of them. Despite that, they also seemed to respect MC better and more realistically than most other Dogenzaka guys do to their MCs.

It was refreshing for them to all simply like MC without an ulterior motive, and each other too.  They were often nice to her and bonded over common things. No matter whose route you were playing, they were helpful and encouraging.

I listed the routes from my best to worst.

Soichiro Toyoizumi
His brother is financially dependent on him, which results in a messy dynamic between himself, his brother, and the MC. His relationship with the MC is quite sweet and fun. they truly bonded and worked together.

He was a little frustrating to get through at times. Early on, he saves MC from an assault and reassures her that she has nothing to apologize for and it wasn't her fault, that's good. Later, both he and his brother harass the MC, not to the same degree, but it felt very tone-deaf.

Mamoru Arashiro (43)
Quite the misogynist here. He had connections to some yakuza and after he quit, it began to haunt him. A woman, who allegedly encouraged him to leave, committed suicide after he left so the man who loved her wanted revenge. He looked good in a suit.

Yorihisa Hodo (51)
He's a writer both you and Ryu like. He uses this as leverage to start a bet with you. Whoever falls in love first loses.

His story is that his wife and daughter died. When MC learns that, she suspects he's being close to her because she resembles his wife, which he confirms, so the MC gets upset, rightfully. Later, he gives MC a dress that belonged to his late wife as a part of his act of love.

Hideaki Kodoma (46)
His relationship with the MC starts quite sweet, both of them eager to develop something. His backstory was heavy but dealt with like an afterthought. It's obvious he's traumatized by it but the only thing he shows is his stress and he heals really quickly once MC gets involved. The writing in his route was a little awkward and strangely rushed as well.

Ryunosuke Yuze (41)
In his main story, you deal with his stalker, who attacks you and him. As a result of trauma, he doesn't trust women. He does say he's wrong to think that way, but he has some lines regarding "women are evil but you're not like other girls."

In his second season, you deal with a man that hates him and wants to steal you. He loses his company and together, you try to get it back.
 
His route is more focused on the plot compared to the others, and the romance is the least steamy, although somewhat more explicit. He was a nice and gentle guy overall, but I'm listing him low because I found his story to be quite dull, and the writing awkward. Despite their nice gestures, MC was distanced from other guys too. Ryu was a little cold toward them in a way he wasn't in others' routes.

[h1] Summary [/h1]
If the concept interests you, I definitely recommend giving it a go. I like the characters and the story, and the general atmosphere created is nice too: a pub and its welcoming regulars there to comfort you. Once the guys open their mouths, it's a very rocky road and may be frustrating to experience. If you're familiar with Dogenzaka games, you know the problems they usually have.
 
Minoru should definitely have been a route.

review:
I agree with what another reviewer said about not going into this game with super elevated expectations.  It is a basic, fairly sweet, occasionally steamy VN. The love interests seem to be fleshed out a lot better than the MC, which I suppose was deliberate on the part of the developers.  However, I felt left wanting to know more about Shiori other than the fact she likes to read, cook, and gets ridiculously over-the-top embarrassed at nudity and sex talk, so much so that one would think she'd been a nun in a past life.  Part of me was unsure why all these urbane, accomplished men were so taken by her other than the fact that she was a pretty young thing who happened to show up at their sausage-fest bar one day. 

So, while not overly compelling, it was cute and a pretty enjoyable way to pass some time. I'd recommend picking it up next time you see it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279016066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1885, 'last_played': 1609744778}
review:
I've been non-stop playing this game during the last two weeks of my life, it's been an experience.

From what I've seen, it's pretty polarizing, either you absolutely love it, or you despise it with your whole being, although there are rare middle-grounds. I adore this game, it's made me laugh out loud because of it's so over the top, but also I've felt very attached to some characters *cough* Mamoru and Hide *cough*. I'm honestly not that experienced with visual novels, I tend to lean to Nitro+Chiral stuff (BL), and the only proper otome I've played is Mystic Messenger so this review is from the perspective of a very occasional visual novel player. 

Also I have a pretty big thing for old 2D men, especially if they're DILFs, so this caters specifically to me, minus the dad part, but anyways they're still old, hot anime men~

But even I must warn about some stuff inside this game, there are some technical issues and some stuff that can be triggering for some people, I actually wanted to recommend this game to someone, but when they asked me if it had some triggers, I couldn't omit some stuff from some routes, and they decided not to play it for their mental health.

The writing is very over the top, but I don't think it would be wise to buy a game named "Pub Encounter: Forbidden Romance" thinking it's a game you should take seriously, I personally had a blast because I was very aware of its potential writing flaws, and I got exactly what I was expecting, making me satisfied. This game is very cliché and requires a big suspension of disbelief, so if you're into liking stuff ironically or like "bad", cliché romance stories I would totally recommend this game. You can easily predict the plot most of the time, but if you like a ride to a predictable, yet entertaining path for pure self-indulgence is very good. In some routes you bang a lot and in some others not so much; but you'll end up banging every romanceable option at some point in the story.

Although Mamoru and Hideaki's routes were the most fast-paced, I got really attached to the characters because they hit all of my husbando boxes (and also have beards) and they have angsty pasts, so I'm soft. I wanna marry Mamoru, the lawyer with a dangerous past and I wanna hug Hide and tell him everything is ok. They are the closest to each other and appear in each other's routes way more than the rest and they get the most worried about each other and are almost always hanging out together so my headcanon is that they're best friends and now ship them with my whole soul, so I'm starving for content *cries* 
Ryu is the sweetest one, Soichiro the most mature and realistic (to the extent of possible within this novel), and Yorihisa is kinda... the manipulative one. 
The MC is kinda dumb at times and her personality is weak, but she shines the most and is very bold on Ryu's route. I'm assuming is like that for the easier the self-projection that kind of bland character has, so I can't really judge her for being written like that. She's in her 20's and I'm currently 20, so from my perspective she's kinda there, but reminds me more of my younger self at times, but she acts like generally like a young adult, a mildly naive adult. She's not really embarrassed by sex, and I heard that most MCs in other games are more childish in that regard so I can relate to her in that aspect because is rare to be embarrassed by it as an adult.

The music is cool and smooth; it has few tracks but they work pretty well. The looping is not perfect, but to the point of feeling distracting or bothersome. This game doesn't have voice acting, and I'm salty about that because the characters (at least the main five) do have official voices because there is a CD drama (yes I'm that deep into this, help). My favorite voices are Mamoru and Hide (I wonder why haha), Mamoru is Rikiya Koyama, and he also voices Shinjuro Rengoku, my current supreme husbando so I'm losing my mind; and Hide is the same VA as Muzan Kibutsuji (sorry, I don't remember his name), and his acting is awesome because his voice adapts so well to Hide, he has great versatility.

I'm an art student, so the sprites and CGs made me suffer a little, but I appreciated the vibe. I liked the backgrounds, although they sometimes had whack perspective, but you can ignore that if you don't really focus on it. The CGs made me wince a little sometimes, the coloring was kinda inconsistent technique-wise and the anatomy was sorta ok, I guess... eh. The artist seemed not to be that experienced drawing older men, the faces are a bit odd, but you can guess easily what type of design feel they were aiming at. Tbh the prettiest (and better drawn character) is Mamoru, but he's my favorite so I'm happy with him. 
I wish they had drawn more character sprites, there were many side characters that appeared constantly in their respective routes depending on the guy you chose that didn't have a sprite (only the main five love interests and Minoru, the gossip grandpa, have sprites) so it was lacking in that regard.

About the triggers, I've seen a lot of people hating on Mamoru because he has some consent issues the first time you bang with him, I considered that scene dub-con because I've read way worse things *coughs in Nitro+Chiral*, but later when you bang, the MC is all the way into it. I didn't really mind about that issue because he's cute and doesn't exist and I'm aware this is a very unrealistic story, but I know some people can't stand that stuff. Another thing is that they call him a manipulator, but I think is really mild compared to what happens in Yorihisa's route, like he's THE manipulator of the game but I don't wanna spoil; his relationship with MC is especially unbalanced and that can also be a turn-off for some. There are other routes that deal with PTSD because of childhood trauma with non-specific nor graphic child abuse, so have that in mind. Another route deals with stalkers, but is mild compared to other media I've seen. 

So, in synthesis, I really like this game despite its many flaws because I knew exactly what to expect from it, and it has made me pass great laughs are heart-fell moments through this self-isolation times, I felt happier in my daily life during these two weeks because I was genuinely invested in this wacky game. 
I would say, buy it if you like this stuff, but wait for a discount.

Now I'mma replay Mamo and Hide's routes and cry while I draw and write MamoHide for my own consumption, sorry if post too much in the art section bc it's almost deserted now and I need to see Mamoru and Hide on a date bye <3

review:
I like that the writers were trying to include more diverse LIs, but my goodness, what the heck is wrong with the character designs? The sprites are okay for the most part, but some of the CGs are TERRIFYING! Especially poor Soichiro, who looks a few days past 100 in his.

Besides Ryunosuke (first season), I didn't really find the routes that interesting or attention-worthy. Soichiro is sweet (BUT OLD), Yorihisa is a jackass, Hideaki is sweet and goofy, and Mamoru has probably been slapped with several sexual harassment suits. MC is a supreme idiot in Mamoru's route which was upsetting.

The stories are pretty short and mostly cliche; the protagonist is yet another nameless, faceless girl in her twenties struggling in a boring office job and lacking any sort of back story, motivations, or ambitions for her future (except somewhat in Ryunosuke's route). 

Overall, my expectations were too high, even for a game called "Pub Encounter" or "Dandy Shot" in the original Japanese. I overall DO NOT recommend this game; however, it may be worth buying on sale just for sweet Ryu.

review:
I normally wouldn't review a VN so early, but the Summer Sale is almost over, so... If you can snap this up for the current sales price of $6.29 USD it's a steal. I only completed the Soichiro route so far, and I'm getting through Ryunosuke, but it's nice to see a otome with older men for a change. The writing is better than My Secret Pets was, and the mc can stand up for herself, at least on the routes I've played.

I'm honestly not sure why so many people insisted on buying it only to harsh on it. If you don't like older guys, don't read it. The mc is certainly old enough to drink in a bar and hold down an office job, so she's old enough to know what kind of guys she wants to date.

UPDATE: AS I finish the story routes, I'll give brief recap here:

Toyoizumi Soichiro: The owner of the pub, and probably the kindest man in the otome. He's reluctant to commit his heart, but once he does, it will be forever. He's romantic and old-fashioned, and although there is passion in him, it doesn't appear in his route right away. I liked Soichiro the best, as he treated the main character like a lady and behaved like a proper gentleman, well, for the most part.

Yuze Ryunosuke: His route can have a rather wonderful ending, but our poor leading lady will put up with a lot to get there. Yuze can be kind of a jerk at times, tender and loving at others. Though he will be the first to defend the mc if it isn't his route, so it's clear he does respect women, and he does treat her decently. His attitude towards women makes sense given his past, but he can seem cold and aloof at times.

Hodo Yorihisa: I honestly wondered if he truly loved the mc at all at some points. He tricks her into dating him, which admittedly isn't too hard once she finds out who he is, then uses a prize to get her to stay in the relationship. In the end he really does love her, and given his backstory his actions, though a bit cruel, are understandable. He at least tries to level the playfield a bit at times, so there is kindness in him.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165536927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2288, 'last_played': 1583773851}
review:
There's a lot of good reviews for this game, but this isn't one of them. However, I explain why I feel that way. I'll put a tl;dr at the end with pros and cons.

When I first saw this game, I was happy to see something with older characters. Most otome's/dating sims/visual novels have high school or college age people getting together. 
While I still like the concept of the guys being middle aged, they should've been a decade or two younger... I'm not sure most of these guys are 'middle aged' anymore.
In Japan, this might be an acceptable thing, but in many countries it's frowned upon for there to be THIS much of an age difference unless the old guy is rich and keeping the younger woman in luxury (read: sugar daddy).

The protagonist is clearly in her early- to mid-20's. She's so naive, I'd lean more towards early 20's (if not flat out 18 or 19). For the purposes of my review, I'm assuming she's 20.
Fine, whatever, dating sims are aimed towards women and many are that age. 
However, these guys are old enough to be her father or grandfather. The youngest guy is 41, and the two oldest don't even have their ages mentioned. She really should be around 30 for this to be cute instead of pedophilic. Is this a dating sim or a lolita sim?

I'll admit to being charmed by two of the routes, which happened to be the second youngest and one that seems to be the oldest though his age isn't specified, but it's not worth the price for two enjoyable routes.
I was bored in most of them. It's definitely a Slice-of-Life sort of game, but it doesn't do it particularly well, and I'm a fan of Harvest Moon and Story of Seasons.

Your character hates her job and has no personality until she meets the guys (can't even call them 'boys' at this point), then her personality changes based on what they want. 
The emphasis is largely on making the guys like you, which isn't uncommon in this type of game, but I wonder why a woman so young would be charmed by men her father's age (daddy issues perhaps?) 
I also see no reason the men should be interested in her, besides the fact that she's young and cute. 

It doesn't go in-depth into the men's backgrounds or why they are the way they are, and when they do mention it, it's like a short, dissatisfying explanation that just blankets over their issues.
Every route has its own conflict that the 'couple' struggles with for most of the route, and most of them are resolved in a way that makes sense, however one of the guy's conflict is resolved way too quickly, especially due to the type of conflict it is.

TL;DR
Pros:
It's different

Cons:
Age difference is huge
Characters are too generic
Protagonist has no personality
Protagonist too young
Most routes are boring
Feels like pedophilia at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024096210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1510, 'last_played': 1708790872}
review:
Gleich zu Anfang möchte ich eine Warnung an trockene Alkoholiker stellen.
Finger weg von diesem Spiel! Ich trinke nicht, hatte aber nach relativ kurzer Spielzeit den unwiederstehlichen  Gusto auf den einen oder anderen Cocktail - und das ist kein Witz.

Die zweite Warnung geht an sehr junge Spieler/innen.
Spart euch das Geld, das Game wird euch nicht gefallen. Wer hängt schon im echten Leben blutjung mit älteren Männern herum, wenn nicht rein finanzielle Interessen dahinter stehen?
Ich habe im Leben noch keinen Fall erlebt.

Dritte Warnung. 
Vermeidet es möglichst, während sich die Geschichte entwickelt, auf die wirklich grauenhafte Grafik zu sehen. Sie ist wie ein Verkehrsunfall. Schrecklich anzusehen, und trotzdem guckt man immer wieder hin.
Also lasst es lieber!
Schaltet statt dessen lieber euer Kopfkino ein, und stellt euch z.B. einen Schauspieler vor, der im Alter der männlichen Protagonisten des Spiels ist. Also zwischen 40 und 50.

Es schüttelt dich bei der Vorstellung vor SO ALTEN Männerm?
Na dann schau dir z.B. einen Patrick Dempsey, er ist über 45 und echt heiss.
Oder "The Rock" Dwayne Johnson, Bradley Cooper, Gerard Butler usw...
Alles keine grünen Jungs mehr, aber heiss wie die Hölle.
Denk also an solche Typen, und vergiss die potthässlichen Grafiken.

Und nun endlich zum Spiel?
Jein - mir persönlich gefiel die musikalische Untermalung gar nicht. Nicht mein Geschmack.
Also habe ich die Musik im Spiel abgedreht, und statt dessen auf YouTube nach Musik gesucht, die ich gerne in einer Bar hören würde. Es gibt da echt tolle Aufnahmen. Zum Beispiel Piano-Musik von einer Stunde und mehr. Passt (für mich) perfekt.

Und jetzt zum Spiel ... endlich wird der ermüdete Leser seufzen.
Halt durch, es lohnt sich.

Man kann der weiblichen Hauptfigut einen persönlichen Namen geben.
Finde ich gut, zieht mich ein bischen mehr in die Geschichte hinein.

Frau ist am Heimweg von einem Job als Sekretärin der sie nervt und ermüdet, und landet auf der Suche nach etwas Ablenkung in der Bar Audire. 
Dort trifft sie auf vier Männer und den Besitzer der Bar, die über den weiblichen Gast mehr als erfreut sind. 
Soweit die Vorgeschichte. Ab da lernt man dann in jedem Kapitel das aus acht Teilen besteht die Männer einzeln näher kennen.

Das Männer über vierzig eine interessante Lebengeschichte haben (können) ist klar. Diese vier und der Barbesitzer haben interessante Geschichten, die von der weiblichen Hauptfigur erforscht werden. Je nachdem wie man Entscheidungen trifft, endet es mit einem guten oder sehr guten Ende. Völliges Verlieren gibt es nicht.

Ein bischen Fingerspitzengefühl und eigene Lebenserfahrung sind beim Lösen der fünf Fälle hilfreich.
Ich persönlich habe in meinem Leben schon den einen oder anderen Typ aus dem Audire kennen gelernt, und kann bestätigen das es keine hanebüchenen Erfindungen sind, die beschrieben werden. Leben eben, mit seinen Sonnen- und Schatten Seiten. Im Game mehr die Schatten Seiten, denn die Männer sitzen nicht ohne Grund jede Nacht in der bar und knallen sich die Birne mehr oder weniger zu.

Negativ bewerte ich die relativ wenigen Entscheidungen die man treffen kann,
und das manche Entscheidung im Spiel abgeschwächt oder uminterpretiert wird. Das sind Fußangeln die unnötig sind.

Negativ sollte ich auch das Benehmen der weiblichen Hauptfigur in manchen Situationen bewerten. Bin damit allerdings vorsichtig, das es wohl der japanischen Vorstellung von weiblich entspricht, wenn Frau schnell errötet, verlegen den Kopf senkt, oder in Tränen ausbricht. Das akzeptiere ich einfach mal so.

Wenig gefallen hat mir die Geschichte mit dem Barbesitzer Soichiro. Bei ihm hat mir mein Kopfkino nicht geholfen, obwohl ich für meine Fantasie eigentlich Vergnügungssteuer bezahlen müsste.
Der Typ ist (für mich) langweilig und betont zu oft, das er der Älteste ist. Auch wenn ich einen Sean Connery im fortgeschrittenen Alter für hot hielt, Soichiro konnte er nicht ausblenden. Seine Geschichte habe ich bischer nicht beendet. Ob ich mich dazu noch aufraffe? Vielleicht nach drei bis vier Kirschlikör ...

Ob ich das Spiel empfehle?
Ja - ausser für trockene Alkoholiker, oder allgemein Menschen mit einem Alkohol Problem.
Ich habe keines. 
Also werde ich mich jetzt wieder in die angenehme Atmosphäre von Audire begeben
und meinen Favoriten Manoru treffen. Das einem Bad Boys aber auch immer so anziehen müssen Ts-ts-ts.
Einen Cocktail habe ich nicht zur hand, aber ein Gläschen Kirschlikör (passend zu Japans Liebe zu Kirschenblüten) tut´s ja auch. Cheers und viel Vergnügen!

For some reason Yuze is the only character given a season 2. While it is unlikley I would like to see the other characters get second seasons as well.

review:
Pub Encounter has a interesting story. Just personally, just not worked out as well as I hope it would be.
To me, the game seems too rushed (special few characters). The background-story and the effect that's it has on the men, need to be more on the foreground. I do dislike the fact the MC has no real backbone and sometimes no common sense.
Yes, I get MC is the loving and supporting MC, but it's depressing to read; every time something go's wrong on her job, she go's to the bar. Not trying to really work on herself or maybe try something else to be better.

The game is clear not for young (or immature) audience. 16+ at least i belief. There will be some darker themes in the story. As life was not kind to your men. But again, for me personally, need more work on that part and effect of it on the characters. 

To me the game was simply not interesting , more boring if i'm honest. The bland MC and characters just didn't make it interesting enough. Really, Ryunoske route, was painful for me to finish, MC and Ryu where too bland. I really was thinking lot of the time; 'what does she/he see in the other?'; because really what is there to love with such a shallow connection/relationship? I do say that Mamoru makes it lots better with his story.

At least the art is good. Clear and nice enough to look at. The music was plus. Really like that music sound.
If you want to buy the game, do it at least when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129409637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1553455926}
review:
The review by rubynxt is spot on so I'm not going into a lot of detail. I started Yorihisa and Mamoru's routes but couldn't finish them. Yorihisa is full of himself and manipulative and the MC is a gullible stuttering shy mess. I stopped early in Mamoru's route. He is an obvious flirt but actually seemed like a good guy in the other guys routes and has really helped them out and was a good friend... aaand then he's pawing all over you the day after you first met and barely spoke to him, gets you drunk, says he's falling in love with you and sleeps over in your bed uninvited when you black out, teases you about messing with you while you were blacked out.. and I stopped playing his route. Eugh... 
The romance scenes are mostly awkwardly written with one CG per route (best one is probably in Ruynosuke's route), it is one of those stories where the MC is pursued by everyone for no apparent reason, and there is a lot of waxing poetically/sappy internal monologuing at times. I mostly laughed at the corny or silly writing and not because it was actually funny. It can be hard to follow who is saying what at times. Probably best to buy on sale. It is ok just don't take it too seriously and avoid those two routes.

Suggested Route order:
Avoid Yorihisa (smug SOB with a green shirt) and avoid Mamoru (Red haired boorish frat creep)

1. Ryunosuke (glasses and suit) - typical kind of route but pleasant with some serious subject matter but it isn't really addressed. The guy is nice and actually a bit shy which can be refreshing.
2. Hideaki (eyebrow scar) - pretty serious subject matter that is very focused on and MC is tearful a lot but they have a pretty good connection even if it is really fast to develope.
3. Shoichiro (older bar tender) - slow burn relationship that is almost too slow at points but thought out at the same time and the most enjoyable I think. The most normal really and nice to leave off on a good note.

review:
大叔控表示一本满足啊。可以说我就是这部游戏的理想受众之一了。乙女向游戏几乎清一色的美少年美青年，能出些满足不同口味人群的作品，我表示很受用啊。

我喜欢的点：
·角色设计丰富  大叔也分不同类型啊，从严谨傲娇(?)到热情放浪，或是儒雅系、热血系、随和系。总有一款能让人喜欢。（我最喜欢安良城护///）
·选择分支简单  选项都很简单啦，想打出Good Ending并不是很难的事情，基本不需要攻略。
· 有中文  一本满足

可以改进的点：
·中文翻译略逊  
·没有自动播放功能  
·美工不够细致

另外还有个问题，我之前在另一台电脑上打通了一个角色的主线，后来换电脑了，想继续通后续故事时发现没有存档了。这游戏可以云存档吗？

review:
While this VN is clearly not as "shelled out" as some other titles, I think it is certainly still worth the purchase ( especially while it is on steam sale for only $6! ). 

I want to start my review by saying that if you go into this game comparing it to big titles like Amnesia, or Hakuouki then you are going to be disappointed. This VN ceratinly would fall into more of what I would expect that you would see on a mobile phone. ( Reminds me of the Shall We Date? series ). The routes are only going to run you about 1 hour to an 1 hour and a half max, and the places you go/elements of the story are certainly more limited in comparison to some other VN's but for this particular title I really think that it just works.

Pub Encounter is a more mature take on a VN, especially when it comes to a VN that is marketed towards female audiences, and this fact alone is one of the reasons that this seemingly more like a mobile VN has become one of my all time favorite VN's. 
The suitors in this game are a bit older ( I believe ranging from 30's up? ) and the issues that the game deals with can be much darker or 'realistic' if you will than other VN's. This may turn some users away, but if you are tired of romancing the same type of immature characters in VN's this will be a breath of fresh air for you. 

The stories I have gone through in the game so far are very emotional, and as I said contain some darker story elements than some other VN's. This game feels a lot more realistic in that regard, and for some that may take away the appeal of the VN. However, for me I really truly loved that aspect about this game. Hideaki's route was really emotional for me, and for that route alone I would reccomend this game. I also absolutely love the art that has been used for this game.

review:
[h1]⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀Welcome to Audire, my dear.[/h1]
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀This is an Otome game where you can romance middle aged men.
⠀⠀Make fun all you want, but hey, this is a VN. I don't know what else you would expect.

Compared to the other Dogenzaka Lab games I have played, this one, in my opinion is the least cancer! This one is still VERY cheesy and cringe but their other ones are just AWFUL! I want to say that I recommend playing them to get your own opinion on them, but be warned. They are really bad.

[u]Summary:[/u] You are walking home one evening from your job(which you are apparently incompetent at), and find your way into the Audire, the lovely little Pub hidden away in an alley way. You meet all the potential [strike]daddies[/strike], I mean, gentlemen, and after introducing yourselves, you are able to pick one to continue a pretty decent storyline with.

🌸 All of these potential lovers are over the age of 40. 
 ⠀⠀⠀⠀Hey, kink-shame all you want internet, but if you are all about that daddy
⠀⠀demographic, then you may enjoy at least one of these lovely lads. They all
⠀⠀have pretty solid and established careers and enjoy giving you attention. Who's
⠀⠀gonna say no to that? :^)

🌸 Music is not very annoying & each men feels different.
 ⠀⠀⠀⠀I'm a sucker for the piano so I have nothing to complain about here. It's very fitting
⠀⠀⠀to the nice, snazzy atmosphere of the pub. Each guy's story comes with their own
⠀⠀⠀history and problems, and they aren't similar to one another which is nice. They will
⠀⠀⠀even say things differently to you. No copy-paste laziness.

🌸 The men are, more or less, VERY well behaved compared to DL`s other VNs.
 ⠀⠀⠀⠀After playing My Butler and Office Lovers, I must stress on how much BETTER 
⠀⠀⠀these men are compared to those games! Most kept their hands at bay or at least
⠀⠀⠀weren't outright overly touchy. Maybe too frank with their dialogue, but at least you
⠀⠀⠀aren't getting molested within the first 5 minutes of meeting them.

💔 I enjoy older men, not old men! [i]/cough/ soichiro /cough[/i]
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀Playing through his storyline made me cringe and uncomfortable, but who am I
⠀⠀⠀to shame those who enjoy raisins. I am not one of them. He was the most gentleman-
⠀⠀⠀like out of them all, but I can't get over how [i]old[/i] he is.

💔 The art style is nice, however some instances make them really awkward and gross.
 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀If you have played any other game by them, you will notice each game comes
⠀⠀⠀ with a different art style. The art in this can be very nice, however a lot of scenes
⠀⠀⠀just look soooo awkward and very bad. No offense to the artist who made 
⠀⠀⠀these lovely men, but some features could have been made differently. 
⠀⠀⠀In my opinion, at least.

I would recommend this game only if you are a fan of these types of games. The stories can be super cheesy, lame, and honestly really weird from time to time. Some of the things they say can be very sweet or over the top, and sometimes things go from 0 to 100 really fast! It`s not necessarily a bad thing, but I live for those wacky moments! If you do not like these kinds of games I don`t think it will be something you would like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116668487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1531527169}
review:
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34863696-Some-Novel-%2528s%2529-called-Otome/?appid=787970] Follow me to see more reviews like this [/url]

[b]Type of Game: [/b] Visual Novel – Reading & Choices
[b]Length: [/b] about 8h  
[b]Story: [/b] 5/10 (if you do not take it seriously) 
[b]Art: [/b] 6/10

Okay, so let's start with why I bought this game: I was reading a book about a relationship, where the girl and the guy have a huge age gap. The book was kind of weird (not because of the relationship per se; some parts of it were just wrong), but since it was told in the perspective of the older guy, it was never really explained, why he had fallen in love with the girl to begin with or what the girl thought about it. That’s why I became curious about a game, which basically screamed at its players that it’s about a girl, who likes older men.  

Therefore, I thought "Well, I know Dogenzaka Lab. I know that their translations are most of the time something to laugh at rather than to take serious (e.g The Men of Yoshiwara: Kikuya), but maybe I can find something in this game that counts as an explanation or idea, what the girl is thinking, when she gets into such a relationship." 

Long story short, I didn't find anything besides a bad translation, clichés and a lot of questionable behaviour. However, at least, I had quite a nice time reading this novel because at some point I took nothing quite serious (and ignored the fact that the age gap is hilariously huge).

Nevertheless, let’s start at the beginning. You’re a cute girl in her 20's, who has a lousy boss and is in need of a drink. Therefore, you go into a "totally-not-suspicious" bar and have a drink with some men. These men are at least two times older than you (the youngest is 43) and everyone has fallen for you at first sight. "Not creepy at all", seems to think the heroine because she stays with them (having a good time apparently) and after that even comes back to the same bar on the next day. Normal behaviour, I guess.

Well, I'm a tough person, I won't be disgusted easily (even, if someone, who may be as old as my grand-dad flirts with the main character), so let's just skip to the things, which made even me think that this game went seriously too far.

Firstly, I am truly fascinated that there is none route [spoiler] besides the sequel of Hideaki's [/spoiler], which mentions the age gap as being somewhat strange, at least. 

Another great thing is that the developers didn't think it would be a wise choice to make the main characters at least a bit mature. I mean, they are guys in their 40's or 50's and act like they are the same age as the heroine. Seriously, why make a game about older men, if the older men are acting like 20-, maybe 25-years old guys? What's the point of that?! 

So that you know, what I am talking about, I am going to make a short introduction of every one of the characters the heroine can romanticize.

Ryunosuke:
Personally, I think this is the route, where I can at least understand the age gap. First of all [spoiler] he is the CEO of her favourite company, so they have a lot of common interests [/spoiler]. Then he is really shy and mysterious to her: She wants to help him and to know him better. She hasn't a lot of experience, so of course he seems amazing. Also, he acts really young [spoiler] because he is traumatized. Therefore, his personality doesn’t feel forced. [/spoiler]

Mamoru:
He, actually, is a great example of what I’ve said before. He acts like a kid, a teenager, who is trying to seduce as many girls as possible – a cheeky brat. [spoiler] Does he have a traumatic cliché past? Yes, of course. [/spoiler]. However, that’s not going to work out, if the guy we are talking about is 46-years old. Honestly, it’s not even about the age gap anymore, he is just sometimes plainly creepy [spoiler] because e.g. he tries to get the main character drunk and then takes her back to her home, with a clear intention… of doing nothing (yay). [/spoiler] Nevertheless, I can’t agree with some people, who told that his route was the worst. There were other routes, where I’d call the police. 

Hideaki:
I said Mamoru was mentally about 20 years old, so, if we consider that, Hideaki has to be about 16-18 years old. [spoiler] He has a traumatic past. Sure thing, but I wonder how they achieved to combine the impossible: A cheerful police officer, who is kind of rough, but at the same time acts like an angsty teen, who can’t get over a traumatic experience, cries a lot and doesn’t have any self-confidence. Quite a paradox. [/spoiler] At least in this route her PARENTS (not she, not him, who weren’t even questioning anything) weren’t okay with their relationship because of the age gap. Thank you. Someone finally noticed it. 

Yorihisa:
Here I started to feel slightly concerned [spoiler] because this guy is 51[/spoiler]. His route told me that it was right to feel so. I think he was crossing the line of what’s acceptable in more than one way. [spoiler]Let’s see: Firstly, he kind of sexually harasses the main character by forcing her to sit on his lap. Plus, the deal. The deal, which would be A REALLY GOOD idea, if this guy WASN’T AN OLD MAN. It's a ‘game’, where the heroine trying to make Yorihisa fall in love with her, while Yorihisa does the same (allowing him to harass her as much as he wants.) in order to make him write a new romance novel because he is, shocking discovery, her favourite author. It gets even better. After being harassed, the main character even starts to like him. And everyone else SUPPORTS IT?! [/spoiler]

Souchiro:
Here I am, by now feeling completely disgusted. Yay! Would you start a romance with your grandfather’s friend? Well, I sure wouldn’t. Our heroine though thinks it’s normal and surprisingly Souchiro does as well. I just can’t find any words to describe this.

I mean, I’m really open-minded, whether you like older guys or not, whether it’s the same gender or not. However, this game is treating it as an every-day occurrence; it doesn’t even try to explain it. It just says: “Oh, Souchiro is so gentle. I’m starting to fall for him.” What about him being as old as your grandparent is (Yorihisa is as old as her father is)? 

Honestly, I would be really disappointed in this game, if I had been hung up on the idea to find out what a girl may think, when she falls in love with people, who are as old as her parents or grandparents.

However, at some point I was just reading it because it was rather hilarious and just so unrealistic that, well, I stopped taking serious, what these people were doing or saying. And then it was pretty much okay to bear.

Nevertheless, some routes were still not okay because it was either just wrong or kind of disgusting. I mean, most of them, would be acceptable, if either the characters were younger, or the story wasn’t centred on their “suffering” and “past”, but instead on the difficulty of building a relationship, while having a huge age gap. It could even have been a really good story.

Apart from that, the writing is bad, the translation is often wrong and sometimes chunks of dialogue repeat in every route. However, I think it’s good that the writing is bad because it really helps to not take this game any serious.

Somehow, I still like some characters and Yorihisa’s story, but if you start looking at the age, everything becomes either creepy or just badly designed. 

In conclusion, I don’t really recommend buying this game, if you want something serious. Something new. Something that isn’t there for just passing time. Something you can think about for hours and contemplate on.

Because this game is just a funny read, if you don’t take anything serious like I did.

review:
《Pub Encounter》是一款文字小說戀愛遊戲，
原本為手機遊戲《Dandy Shot》，後來才移植於Steam平台上。
玩家將扮演一名上班族，某日下班後走進一間名為Audire的酒吧，
認識了店內的店長與常客（全是大叔），與大叔們展開戀情的故事。

【優點】
+Steam版本內建簡體中文字幕
+可攻略的5個角色全是大叔，適合我這種大叔控
+每個角色都有正篇→後話→約會劇本三段劇情
 只有湯瀨龍之介的有額外的續篇劇情跟CG
+每個角色都至少有5張CG，其中一張必為床戲CG
+劇情選擇不難（都是二選一），不必特地看攻略
 《Pub Encounter》的劇情選擇都不難，憑直覺選都會選到Best Ending
 不像其他文字小說戀愛遊戲難到靠北，得看攻略才能選到Best Ending
+有Steam交換卡片可以收集

【缺點】
-似乎沒有Steam雲端儲存進度的功能？
 我之前在A電腦攻略的角色進度跟CG，換了B電腦之後就消失了
-Good Ending比Best Ending還難達成
-遊戲BGM單調，沒認真投入劇情的話，很容易睡著

如果你和我一樣是大叔控，又對文字小說類型的戀愛遊戲有興趣，
那麼我很推薦這款《Pub Encounter》，每個大叔都有自己的煩惱與可愛的一面，
另外玩家扮演的女主角在這款遊戲裡非常大膽主動，常讓大叔們嚇一跳XD
但不建議用原價NT$438購買此款遊戲，等特價時再買就好了
印象中我特價買到時-67%才NT$150上下

偶尔有几句骚话的傻白甜橙光系快餐乙女游戏，整体还是素质一般。适合想打发时间偶尔体验一下无脑傻白甜恋爱的累了girl们，这里还是点一个不推荐。顺便说一句日文文本不难读，如果可以就放弃中文版吧；中文翻译有一些翻译腔，偶尔会出现不通顺的句子，并且有错别字[spoiler]你愿意陪我妈[/spoiler]和没排版的地方。

被叔系攻略对象吸引，刚开始还是很新鲜的感觉，[spoiler]想不到我一把年纪了还会被小姑娘强吻[/spoiler]第一个选了总裁线，玩了一两个小时后开始和基友疯狂吐槽。
[spoiler]什么叫被他的眼神刺穿啊！他是Dio吗！会空裂眼刺惊的吗！ [/spoiler]
[spoiler]这水蓝色内衣为什么还有黑边的啊好丑啊！！！[/spoiler]
[spoiler] “双唇在我脖子上蠕动”……蠕动？？？？？[/spoiler]
街头偶遇这么容易的吗！没事出个门就能碰到剧情关键人物！这么厉害的吗！

- 没法鼠标滚轮上下翻对白，操作不适。按空格键前进会有音效并且找不到取消的地方。
- 没有配音，显得更加廉价。
- 美术部分怀疑是直男做的。
- 其实剧情有bug。[spoiler]中年男人身上怎么可能有香甜的味道[/spoiler] 

+ 比较友好的地方是选了一个人的线以后其余角色会自动变成给力助攻（毕竟都是大叔，解释成把女主当女儿辈的小姑娘来照顾也没问题），避免胃疼剧情，完美结局也很容易打出来。（但是对喜欢胃疼剧情的盆友来说无疑是个巨大缺点）在单人剧情里也不缺乏其他角色的戏份。
+ 一些对白的细节感觉还不错。
+ 叔系 好的 我吃
+ 傻白甜也不坏

感觉优缺点各有一半的这种游戏，玩到的话比单纯玩一个垃圾游戏或者一个好游戏更尴尬……
[spoiler]其实我最喜欢的是树神！他真可爱。但是他抽烟，还是out了[/spoiler] 

啊……我还是想玩制作精良的叔系乙女恋爱游戏啊。

review:
スマホの「Dandy Shot」という乙女ゲームのパソコン版。

　シナリオは一本でルート分岐なし。選択肢で好感度が上がっていき、一定の好感度以上で最終章を終えると、ベストエンド。そうでなければグッドエンド。１人2時間あれば両エンディングをみてスチルコンプまで出来るので、乙女ゲームとしては軽い部類に入ると思います。

　おじさまの設定は魅力的だと思うのですが、主人公に感情移入しにくいところがあります。その上、シナリオ自体が単調でテンポもあまりよくないので、好みのおじさまだけ攻略したらもういいかな。という印象が強いです。
　ラブラブさを表現したいのかは分かりませんが、ティーンズコミックレベルの官能描写がちょこちょこ出て来てそれに関するスチルもあるので、そう言ったものを乙女ゲームに求めていない人にもあまりお勧めできません。

　ドラマCDも出ていてそっちの評判がいいので、声が多少なりついてるのかなと思いましたが、声は一切なく効果音もなくただBGMが流れるだけで、パソコンであえてやる理由が見つからないです。ドラマCDにまでなっていてPC移植なら振るボイスは無理でも多少の声、せめて効果音は欲しいなと思ってしまいます。

review:
I've been playing a good amount of Otome games in the last few years. Games like Hakuouki, Sweet Fuse, Amnesia and some others.
In comparison to those Pub Encounter is almost bland. The different storylines are interesting but of course not breathtaking, I mean it's normal life guys^^. Presentation and GCs are good and the music is...well it's there ;-).

So why do I like this game so much, despite the fact that it is only average in every regard except for the cast of men, to choose from? You maybe guessed it, it's because they're all beyond 40 years old, mature gentlemen so to say but don't take the gentlemen thing too serious. One reviewer here complained about the guys acting like some lovecrazy teenagers but that's actually exactly like reality is, age doesn't make a difference here...I think I should know, I have a thing for older men, so of course I dated some and there really is no big difference xD.

I wished though, that the stories would have focused a little more on the age gap promlematic but it's okay.

In my opinion this game is a must have if you're into the "Ossan" stuff ;-).

And finally my short thoughts on every route, going from least favourite to most favourite:

1. Mamoru
He's hot no doubt but I really disliked the chemistry between the MC and Mamoru, along with the overal behaviour of the MC (but that could count as a negative in probably every route).

2. Yorihisa
Very manipulating but somehow interesting to see the MC fall for him. He also has some charme but that's it.

3. Ryunosuke
One of the two routes with the most normal dating activities, the MC is the more avtive part here, I liked that. The rest of the story is okay.

4. Hideaki
Now, his route was actually a big surprise for me^^. I chose him the last because I liked him the least at first sight. Who would have thought what an interesting and charming character he is behind that silly mask. The background story was very good, too.

5. Soichiro
I guess many will not understand why he's my favourite in the whole game but well...he's just such a sweet old gentleman, who's still on edge, how can one not like that? He may be the oldest of the cast but that makes his route even more interesting in my opinion :3.

So in short: Recommended :-)

review:
I saw this popped up in my queu, so I decided to try it out. The idea of having older men as potential love interests was interesting, if not refreshing from the typical otome game. However, my excitement quickly turned into dissapointment.

The artwork is alright, but the plot is horrible. Since the love candidates are older men, I was expecting more mature contents (not just smut). Everything feels really rushed and the character developments of your love interests are choppy. I'm not sure if there's some glitches in the game, but sometimes I felt the dialogues just jumped from one thing to another without a smooth transition, which makes things a bit incoherent. Perhaps it was the issues with the translation. I've played many otome games, and this one is just mediocre. I pushed myself to finish Hideki's route, but I couldn't continue with the game. 

If you are more interested in just getting the guy and the smut content, then maybe this is for you. But if you're looking for something with more in-depth storyline, then I recommend you to pass this one.

review:
At first I wasn't so sure about getting this game but because it was the first time seeing a game where the guys were way older than you made me give it a chance and...

I don't regret it at all.
It feels good to see old people as your love interests. There is a moment when you are over 20, that dating <18 feels... weird so playing this game made me feel like I was in once again.

They all have their problems, their own way to be. They don't have teenager problems but small traumas from when they were younger. You help them to get over them, to give them a reason to love once again.

It taught me about the drinks too, I am not a drinker myself but I didn't know that the coktels could have a meaning.

review:
Here we go again. Another mobile VN by Dogenzaka Labs with the same problems as almost every other Dogenzaka Labs (The final achievement doesn't unlock because it's missing from the game file again and the developers will take a week to notice the problem and another week to try and fix it).

tl;dr- not for you if you don't like badly written sex scenes and dating middle-aged men

I enjoyed Pub Encounters, but I was also immensely disgusted by it. The fact that you could romance some guy [spoiler]who was probably over 60-freaking-years-old[/spoiler] was enough to make me stop playing it. 

Buying this game will give you:
[list]
[*] 5 romanceable guys + sequel route for one of them
[*] expensive Steam trading cards
[*] great artwork of middle aged men??
[*] several hours worth of reading
[*] music that keeps looping itself because it's too short
[*] some awkward English translations
[*] the ability to play in English, Japanese or Chinese
[*] awkwardly written ecchi sketchy sex scenes
[*] morality issues
[/list]

I would not recommend this game to anyone who avoids smut-like material. If you could get past the fact that the romanceable characters are middle aged men, then I would suggest buying it in the Dogenzaka Labs bundle on sale (it's really not worth the money. You're better off using the money from buying the game at full price to buy one Train Simulator DLC). For me, this game was just gross in general and I understand that the romanceable guys have to be their age. I just wish the game revealed the age of the player character because [spoiler]they wrote her like she was a 28-year-old and the youngest of the five guys is 41, which did not sit with me right at all[/spoiler]. 3/10

review:
What I expected: Reading the reviews I expected to fulfill a guilty pleasure and be transport to Smut Town. 
What I got: Story arcs that were much more interesting and deep than the smut I came for and I came to like this game for different reasons. 

It's a pretty decent VN. I wish they spent a little more time weeding out the typos and made the sex stuff a little less laughably bad but hey. For something I've never seen before, I'm willing to excuse this for something novel. I have seen older men act like horndogs (especially in bars) so that wasn't a shock to me. What was a shock was a lot of the routes end with over the top posessiveness. I've never been one to like that in real relationships but I get the market of these types of games and I just happen to be an outlier.  

Anyway, enough complaints. The shining pinnicle of this game other than the men, are their stories. I like that they weren't just bullshit angsty crap that a lot of highschool type VN's exhibit. You know like, "Oh man. I was rejected by some chick ONCE and now I can't love again." This shit is like, "So I was kidnapped and tortured and I'm basically traumatized forever." They felt more or less believable with a little bit of coincidence to drive the plot thrown in and I really, truly, loved that they were struggling with real shit.

Routes in order of my favourite to least favourite: 
Soichiro - Ah~ *swoon*
Ryunosuke - I don't get WHY he's the only one with a part 2. But he's all kinds of awesome so I suppose I'll let it slide.
Hideaki - His passed is so fucked up but I related to him the most because mine is too. Not that we went through the same thing but it was nice to have a relatable character.
Mamoru - I thought he was gonna be a slimeball. I was... sort've wrong? I just don't like overly sexual, possessive, slightly controlling men who don't listen to no so... But his route got better the more I played it. 
Yorihisa - Not my type. He's a asshole. Straight up fucking... You don't play with people like that even if you managed to get over yourself enough to actually fall in love.

The end. <3

review:
非常棒的体验，好久没玩这么不矫情的乙女游戏了（大概是因为主角们都是中年大叔吧）。
虽然设定上有些玛丽苏，但是这姑且也算是乙女游戏的要素之一，而且也在可接受的范围之内。
画风上我个人觉得还不错，很适合中年大叔这样的角色设定，当然这一点还是因人而异。不过看宣传图就觉得画风不好看的也不大可能会考虑买游戏吧。

从剧情上来说，各位大叔真的都非常棒，性格上也有各自的特点和缺陷，暂时只玩完了龙之介和警察大叔两条，但是已经感受到了大叔的魅力！！！这游戏简直是叔控福音！！！为了不剧透就不多说了。但是只能说这部作品里很难见到那些让你觉得很尴尬的狗血情节，恋爱进度可能有些快，但基本不矫情，非常顺畅。
在此感谢作者。

不过游戏的缺点也很明显……
最大的问题就是中文版本的翻译，真的有非常严重灾难，有很多的语法不通和错别字，虽然不影响游戏剧情的阅读，但是很容易就让人情感上出戏。而这个问题也只好期待作者的更新来解决了，如果能找到一位更合适的翻译就更好了_(:зゝ∠)_
所以有能力的话还是尽量使用日文版本或英文版本。

总之这就是这样一款很棒的乙女游戏，喜欢大叔的玩家一定不要错过，大♀人的恋爱在等着你哟。

review:
[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WD1QLS-2JOg]Full review on Youtube[/url]

A steamy, melodramatic romance game that mixes charming men with cheesy dialog. It's pretty much the otome game equivalent of a dollar-store romance novel.

Pros:

- Attractive and charismatic older male characters
- Gorgeously drawn CGs
-  A unique and somewhat off-beat premise


Cons:

- Almost zero variation: the choices you make affect two lines of dialog at a time, only diverging at the end of the game.
- Infrequent typos and sprite errors
- Repetitive soundtrack
- The overwrought melodrama may be tough for some to stomach.

Fans of "ossan" characters will probably find at least one guy they love to death, but for people who aren't really "into" older guys, the story's too insubstantial to warrant much attention.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296347139', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1423, 'last_played': 1474469255}
review:
Not recommended.

While routes' plots do vary, from one extremity to another, it really seems kind of unreal. Okay, games are not necessarily supposed to be "real" but I expected less dramatic plot twists. They were alright, besides that one route that made me see one of my favorite characters in an utterly different light. (And it's not a good thing.)

The art is... Okay. Obviously, they look older and I don't mind that, but... It's definitely only okay. I mean, one of the characters is 60, but he looks over 70... That's a bit too much for me. And backgrounds are a little fuzzy.

Now, the characters. Out of five romanceable guys, only one is romanceable (and a little squee-worthy because he is sweet). One is way too old (looking) and two of them are horribly manipulative. The fifth was just... okay. And some of them were quite childish for 40+ years old men...

There definitely were typos, some even hilarious. Like the MC apparently puts their own body in a bag... But I'm not a native English speaker, so I don't necessarily notice everything, so it didn't bother me that much.

My conclusion is... Save your money. A few good bonus stories isn't enough to make for 4 routes that are either horrible, unremarkable or boring. At least, not from my point of view.

review: I've played my fair share of Dozengaka Lab games but I've got to say Pub Encounter is my favorite.  At first, I wasn't sure what to make of it. Maybe it was because I had been drinking along with the game, but hey!  I still feel pleased about every encounter even when I've sobered up. As a warning for the prudish out there, there are a lot of romance/sex scenes here but I didn't feel them to be vulgar.  They were definitly erotic though.

(OK so maybe I just happened to be the target audience for this masterpiece... your mileage may very. LOL.) Also, I WISH THIS BAR WAS A REAL PLACE. I would go there. Every. Effing. Night. And. Day. It's hard to find a classy bar, ya know? Esp one filled with sexy ojisans. :-P

Bought solely for Ryu's story but I will probably try the other ones at some point too. Though truthfully the way the other men (e.g. not Ryu) are drawn, it looks like they're either crack addicts with weird sunken in eyes, or just old grandpas. @__@; I can probably get past that part and enjoy the stories even if some of them are hopelessly predictable. 

So far the only exposure I have had to the protagonist is thru Ryu's story, and she seems more dom than most Japanese generic female MCs. So I am hoping she doesn't act like a 'tard in the other routes, though after reading some of the other reviews that cite other routes, I am starting to lose hope, LOL.

So yay!! :D I hope they make more 'niche' otome games like this where you can woo older men. 'Cause some of us perverts are into that. xD

It's not one big free-for-all which to me, kinda makes the concept lose its allure just a tad. But not a dealbreaker for me. I like the 'freedom to choose' concept...and the idea you could end up falling for another guy instead of the one you originally set out to get is thrilling to me...er...or something. LOL. review:
At first, I was excited about this game. As a middle-aged lady who loves otome, I was tickled by the prospect of finally having romance options that are close my own age. I was so looking forward to a mature, interesting story that didn't revolve around school. However, Pub Encounters turned out to be a disappointment.

My biggest gripe is the main character. She is just so incredibly, annoyingly, frustratingly STUPID. I've managed to make it through two routes, and in both she is hopeless. She cries at everything. She's sad, she cries. She's happy, she cries. Someone scuffs a shoe, she cries. The sky is blue, she cries. She puts herself in ridiculous and dangerous situtions and then just sort of bumbles along with the consequences. She's bland, uninspired and downright forgettable.

Plus, the two routes I managed to slog through were boring. I knew coming in that this was a slice of life game. I knew not to expect adventures, like I had in Code:Realize. But, geez louise. All the stories really consisted of were the main character looking longingly into the distance while the men made thinly veiled, sexual comments and undressed her with their eyes. There was nothing to these stories, at all. NOTHING.

I'm not sure I can make myself slog through the rest of the routes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999732661', 'num_games_owned': 1755, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 1914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1834, 'last_played': 1568319813}
review:
It’s been a LONG while since I’ve been compelled to write a review, and it took a game so incredibly bad to push me over the edge, but I’m doing it for posterity.  I simply cannot let the horrors of Pub Encounter go unannounced.  This review will be less formal than most, as the emotions boiling within me are too strong to temper with pretty words and structured paragraphs, so I apologize in advance.  I also apologize to anyone who has played this and absolutely loved it.  Save yourself the anger over what I’m about to say and scroll past the following paragraphs right to the “thumbs down” button as I am sure you will feel obliged to do.  But let it be known that I begrudge no one their pleasures. I have some rather odd fetishes myself, but Pub Encounter is well beyond what I would consider enjoyable in any way.  If there’s one word I would use to describe how I feel about it, it would be disgusted…and dirty.  Ok, so two words.

I’ve always found the idea of romancing older characters in otome games intriguing.  This is ground that is rarely tread upon, and to finally see a title that unabashedly embraces the premise was exciting beyond belief.  I just knew I had to play Pub Encounter as the potential for interesting and unconventional storytelling was evident.  If only I hadn’t been blinded by my enthusiasm, perhaps I would have been prepared for what I was about to face.  Truthfully, even the game title was a huge red flag that I ignored in my starry-eyed daze.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=673359399
Pub Encounter begins with our stressed out protagonist stopping at a bar after work for a drink and to put another day of mistakes behind her.  Walking into the dimly-lit establishment, she is faced with 5 middle-aged men, 3 of which instantly begin drooling over her as if she were the fresh kill that the pack leader just drug in.  I’m no expert on human interaction, but I’m pretty sure men in their 40’s and 50’s do not act anything like the characters in this game.  Even pubescent teenage boys do not act anywhere near as creepy as these men.  If this were me, after being nearly accosted by the lawyer and writer of the group, I’d have quickly drained my glass and left, never to return.  But our young and “intelligent” protagonist decides to make her way back to the bar yet again as one of the potential sex offenders has lingered on her mind ever since.

Aside from the fact that the novel was clearly written for the sole purpose of having the MC sleep with her chosen beau as many times as can be squeezed into a story that is only 8 chapters long (9 if you count the ending), the writing is absolutely atrocious.  To be fair, the translation itself is pretty good with few typos and awkward phrasings; but the things these characters say, how they act and carry themselves, and the lack of intriguing (not to mention plausible) back stories for any of the leads makes reading through the drudge a painful chore.  My brain began shutting down after finishing the second of the five routes, and as I started up Mr. Cop’s storyline, I felt sweat beading on my forehead as I faced another 3+ hours of mind-numbing boredom.  There is no substance present at all, and the characters are so poorly conceived that I could not find within me any semblance of interest in experiencing how their stories resolved.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=682369947 
This is to say nothing of the protagonist who is the most frustrating and stupid character I’ve ever had the displeasure of playing.  She constantly places herself in situations that in real life would have had her dead on the side of the road somewhere. Then there’s the fact that she trusts and falls for these men without knowing ANYTHING about them except that they want her so bad they can’t take it.    

Which leads me to Pub Encounter completely squandering its potential for romance with older characters. I realize some of the effect may be lost in translation as the MC may be speaking more formally to them in Japanese, but the stories themselves barely emphasize the age difference at all. It's just the MC getting all hot for one of the guys, some ridiculous back story, and then 3+ chapters of them screwing each other's brains out. And the sex scenes aren't even appealing or titillating, they’re embarrassingly awkward and stupid.  At one point I questioned whether the writer even understands how the human body works.   

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=681366354
I realize that R18 otome titles are rare, and that many female readers are desperate for anything they can get their hands on, but we need to demand better.  If this is what passes for mature storytelling, I'll pass.  I'll take a well-written, yet chaste, love story over this tripe any day of the week. The allure of the chase, blossoming relationship and eventual confession of love is lost when the MC has already fallen head over heels for her beau and sleeps with him by Chapter 3.  Though perhaps it was my mistake expecting anything more of Pub Encounter than the trashy erotica that it is.

Bottom Line: Strongly Not Recommended!
